image.altText: An older man wearing a navy blue polo shirt leans against a pillar outside his home wearing sunglasses with his arms folded.

items.synopsis: As former Qantas workers celebrate their historic victory over the airline in the High Court, an industrial relations lawyer says any compensation bill or financial penalty won't affect Qantas' bottom line — or stop them from outsourcing jobs in the future.

title.children: After being sacked, Don took Qantas to court and won. But experts say the airline could outsource jobs again

image.altText: A man's hands fix a bridle to a horse.

items.synopsis: Victoria's racing watchdog has found "ritualised violence" and sexual assault has been rife in the industries for generations.

title.children: Racing integrity commissioner 'personally devastated' by report detailing decades of industry abuse

image.altText: A flooded street with boats and rescue vehicles and people

items.synopsis: New analysis of Australia's costliest natural disasters shows the danger posed by cyclones and flooding to the nation's east coast.

title.children: Costly cyclone disaster looms for Australia’s east coast

image.altText: A Qantas aircraft is seen on the tarmac through a circular window.

items.synopsis: Public servants from the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission and the Civil Aviation and Safety Authority have accepted membership to Qantas’ invite-only Chairman’s Lounge, while their agencies were responsible for regulating the airline.

title.children: Senior public servants responsible for regulating Qantas accepted Chairman’s Lounge invitations

image.altText: A man of Asian appearance wears a suit and steps out of a luxury car as its door is held open by someone else.

items.synopsis: Kim Jong Un vows support for Russia during a summit that the US warns could lead to more munitions for Moscow's war in Ukraine.

title.children: North Korea's leader vows full support for Russia's 'just fight' after viewing launchpads with Putin

image.altText: Kim and Putin shaking hands

items.synopsis: With few allies left on the world stage, the meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean President Kim Jong Un is seen by observers as a sign of just how far Russia has fallen.

title.children: 'Russia would not be doing this if it had other options': Putin's desperate meeting with Kim Jong Un

image.altText: Two tall penguins stand face to face with small chicks at their feet

items.synopsis: Scientists say warming ocean temperatures are having an alarming impact on Antarctic sea ice levels, with currently 1.5 million square kilometres less sea ice than is typical at this time.

title.children: 'We've caused this': Climate scientists issue warning over Antarctic sea ice levels

image.altText: A young man with dark hair in dirty clothing is held by the arms by camouflaged armed men as they walk on a road.

items.synopsis: Convicted murderer Danelo Cavalcante had been on the run since August 31, when he escaped from Chester County Prison by climbing between two walls in the jail house yard and scrambling onto the roof.

title.children: 'Crab-walking' Pennsylvania prison escapee recaptured after two-week-long manhunt

image.altText: Brayden Maynard smiles while holding a football at Collingwood training

items.synopsis: The AFL concedes the Brayden Maynard tribunal decision "will not sit well with everyone" while accepting the not guilty verdict.

title.children: AFL to review Maynard case after the season, as Demons player's father slams 'jaw-dropping' decision

image.altText: Nick Kaldas addressing the National Press Club

items.synopsis: The chair of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide takes the unusual step of addressing the National Press Club, insisting he did so because the inquiry is failing to gain enough attention in the media or with politicians.

title.children: 'The issues we've uncovered have not been noticed': Royal commissioner speaks out

image.altText: a person in an Akubra hat silhouetted against an Indigenous flag

items.synopsis: The debate over the creation of a Indigenous advisory body has burst into a cacophony of noise, misinformation, confusion and abuse. We've been here before, writes Bridget Brennan.

title.children: Above the noise, there's one Voice we could be listening to

items.synopsis: Apartment owners could share cars as parking-free housing is introduced to curb major cities' traffic congestion.

title.children: Are Australians ready to give up their cars? Urban planners warn home buyers might not have a choice

image.altText: A USB-C cable in front of an Apple logo.

items.synopsis: One of the biggest changes to Apple's new iPhone is its charging port. Here is why it has moved from a Lightning cable to USB-C.

title.children: Apple's new iPhone has a different charging port, having ditched the Lightning cable

image.altText: Flowers on a street

items.synopsis: Melbourne's Wesley College leads the tributes for John Haasz, who was killed in the Friday night crash in the city's CBD.

title.children: Melbourne man killed in Bourke Street incident led 'remarkable life'

image.altText: Uniformed police standing on a footpath next to their vehicles parked on a street.

items.synopsis: Police say there is no longer a threat to public safety after multiple reports from the public of gunshots being fired in the northern Perth suburb of Clarkson.

title.children: Scared kids hid under desks for hours as primary school locked down after erroneous reports of gunshots

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie and a face mask

items.synopsis: The woman who cannot be identified says she was groomed by the convicted murderer while she was a student in the 1980s.

title.children: 'Ought to have known': former student of killer Chris Dawson sues state

image.altText: Police cars behind a road closed sign on the Goulburn Valley Highway.

items.synopsis: The Goulburn Valley Highway is closed in both directions after the incident this afternoon. The 30-year-old male driver of one of the vehicles is in hospital in a stable condition.

title.children: 67-year-old woman dies in collision between ute, station wagon on Victorian highway

image.altText: Sydney Opera House lit up in Green and Gold

items.synopsis: The Opera House remained bare in May for the coronation of King Charles III, due to a $75,000 price tag, but emails show the true cost was much lower.

title.children: Decision not to light up Opera House for King Charles coronation was political, emails reveal

image.altText: Solar panels in a field

items.synopsis: The renewable energy sector says large investment is urgently needed to keep up with the United States' landmark IRA bill.

title.children: 'There is no greater priority': The $100b call to keep Australia in the renewable race

image.altText: A group of people, fronted by a man talking and pointing upwards, outside the High Court.

items.synopsis: Qantas took a long-running battle with the Transport Workers' Union over sacked staff to the High Court, where the airline lost its appeal.

title.children: Qantas workers celebrate historic 'The Castle vibes' win after High Court ruled the airline illegally sacked staff

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers during Question Time.

items.synopsis: One of the most prominent backers of the Voice to Parliament says comments she made at a forum in regional Western Australia have been misreported.

title.children: 'Weirdest whispers from furthermost fringes': Voice debate ramps up in final days of sitting fortnight

image.altText: A crime scene on a suburban street

items.synopsis: Detectives believe a shooter fired from the road or footpath outside the boy's Endeavour Hills home, striking the teen and leaving him with non-life-threatening injuries.

title.children: Teenage boy shot while asleep in bed in Melbourne's south-east, police say

image.altText: a lady in ambulance uniform stands in front of two male colleagues

items.synopsis: A paramedic tearfully tells a court she thought she may be seriously hurt when she was assaulted in the cells of the Bendigo Police Station earlier this year.

title.children: Paramedic still has nightmares after attack by drunk woman in police station, court told

image.altText: Flinders Street Station in Melbourne's CBD

items.synopsis: A high-profile incident that left one man dead and five others injured has put Melbourne residents on high alert, and raised questions over the city's safety.

title.children: Is Melbourne less safe than it was? We analysed the data to find out

image.altText: Man in blue button shirt with slacks, sunglasses and coat shields his face with a piece of paper as he walks into courthouse

items.synopsis: Kristin MacDonald was convicted of eight charges but acquitted of nine others after pleading not guilty to accessing protected waters surrounding what he claimed was a "micronation" off the coast of Western Australia.

title.children: Magistrate fines self-declared 'prince' of Abrolhos Islands $4,600 for fisheries offences

image.altText: A jetty submerged with foreboding, dark clouds in the distance.

items.synopsis: Severe weather lashes large parts of Western Australia, as strong winds and heavy rain cause havoc across Perth and the south west of the state.

title.children: Residents in shock after 'little tornado' sends flying debris through suburbs, severe weather lashes WA

image.altText: Several firefighters standing around a ute parked on the side of an outback highway, with bushfire smoke in the background.

items.synopsis: A large bushfire has jumped containment lines to the north and south of the Northern Territory town of Tennant Creek, authorities say.

title.children: Bushfire jumps containment lines near Tennant Creek as SA crews join firefighting effort

image.altText: A side shot of a man's face and neck.

items.synopsis: A parliamentary probe investigating links between former cabinet minister Stuart Robert and a Canberra lobbying firm, and the subsequent awarding of government contracts calls on the National Anti-Corruption Commission to investigate the saga.

title.children: Former cabinet minister Stuart Robert referred to national corruption body

image.altText: Smoke rises at a shipyard.

items.synopsis: At least 24 people have been injured after a missile attack on the Sevastopol Shipyard, the Russian-installed governor says.

title.children: Crimean shipyard on fire, two ships damaged in Ukrainian missile attack

image.altText: Two Adelaide United players celebrate.

items.synopsis: Former Adelaide United captain Craig Goodwin fires a bitter parting shot at the club, saying he has been left feeling "hugely disappointed" at how his departure was handled.

title.children: 'Hugely disappointed' Socceroo takes aim at Adelaide United over departure to Saudi Arabia

image.altText: Woman holding an award

items.synopsis: It's always about show-stopping shock value with the Video Music Awards as season favourites and upcoming stars are celebrated. Here are the winners and who wore what.

title.children: MTV VMAs: Winners, fashion and why NSYNC made a special appearance

image.altText: Valentine Holmes

items.synopsis: The NRL issues Valentine Holmes a breach notice for a since-deleted social media post, alleging the North Queensland Cowboys player broke the league's code of conduct.

title.children: Valentine Holmes issued NRL breach notice after deleted social media post

image.altText: A group of tourists, part of them wearing facemasks, are pictured on St Mark's Square in Venice.

items.synopsis: The city's tourism council says it is not a money-making move, and that the fee will only cover the cost of administering the scheme.

title.children: Venice is planning to charge tourists $8 a day to visit. Here's why
